socket.h File Reference

This file contains headers about socket abstraction layer. More...

#include <sys/types.h>
#include <sys/socket.h>
#include <netinet/in.h>

Go to the source code of this file.

Functions

int sal_socket (int domain, int type, int protocol)
 Creates an endpoint for communication and returns a descriptor.
int sal_connect (int sockfd, const struct sockaddr *addr, socklen_t addrlen)
 Initiate a connection on a socket, If the socket sock is of type SOCK_DGRAM then addr is the address to which datagrams are sent by default, and the only address from which datagrams are received. If the socket is of type SAL_SOCK_STREAM, this call attempts to make a connection to the socket that is bound to the address specified by addr.
ssize_t sal_sendto (int sockfd, const void *buf, size_t buflen, int flags, const struct sockaddr *dest_addr, socklen_t addrlen)
 Transmit a message on a socket If sal_sendto() is used on a connection-mode (SOCK_STREAM) socket, the arguments dest_addr and addrlen are ignored (and the error EISCONN may be returned when they are not NULL and 0) Otherwise, the target address is given by dest_addr with addrlen specifying its size.
ssize_t sal_send (int sockfd, const void *buf, size_t buflen, int flags)
 Transmit a message on a socket.
ssize_t sal_recvfrom (int sockfd, void *buf, size_t buflen, int flags, struct sockaddr *src_addr, socklen_t *addrlen)
 Receive a message on a socket.
ssize_t sal_recv (int sockfd, void *buf, size_t buflen, int flags)
 Receive a message on a socket.

 Bind a name to a socket.

 Listen for connections on a socket.

Detailed Description

This file contains headers about socket abstraction layer.

Date:
06/06/2012
Author:
frederic.dhaeyer@parrot.com

Function Documentation

int sal_accept ( int  sockfd,
struct sockaddr *  addr,
socklen_t *  addrlen 
)

Accept a connection on a socket.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to send
addr The address
addrlen The size of address
Return values:
On succes, a nonnegative integer is returned. Otherwise -1 is returned if an error occurred and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h).
int sal_bind ( int  sockfd,
const struct sockaddr *  addr,
socklen_t  addrlen 
)

Bind a name to a socket.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to send
addr The address
addrlen The size of the address
Return values:
On succes, 0 is returned. Otherwise -1 is returned if an error occurred and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h).
int sal_close ( int  sockfd  ) 

Close a socket.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket to close
Return values:
On success, 0 is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned, and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h)
int sal_connect ( int  sockfd,
const struct sockaddr *  addr,
socklen_t  addrlen 
)

Initiate a connection on a socket, If the socket sock is of type SOCK_DGRAM then addr is the address to which datagrams are sent by default, and the only address from which datagrams are received. If the socket is of type SAL_SOCK_STREAM, this call attempts to make a connection to the socket that is bound to the address specified by addr.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to connect
addr The address to connect.
addrlen The size of the addr
Return values:
On success, 0 is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h)
int sal_listen ( int  sockfd,
int  backlog 
)

Listen for connections on a socket.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to send
backlog The maximum length to which the queue of pending connections for sockfd may grow
Return values:
On succes, 0 is returned. Otherwise -1 is returned if an error occurred and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h).
ssize_t sal_recv ( int  sockfd,
void *  buf,
size_t  buflen,
int  flags 
)

Receive a message on a socket.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to send
buf The buffer to fill with data received
buflen The buffer size
flags The bitwise OR of zero or more of the socket flags
Return values:
On success, the number of bytes received is returned. 0 is returned when the peer has performed an orderly shutdow. Otherwise -1 is returned if an error occurred and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h).
ssize_t sal_recvfrom ( int  sockfd,
void *  buf,
size_t  buflen,
int  flags,
struct sockaddr *  src_addr,
socklen_t *  addrlen 
)

Receive a message on a socket.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to send
buf The buffer to fill with data received
buflen The buffer size
flags The bitwise OR of zero or more of the socket flags
src_addr The source address
addrlen The size of the source address
Return values:
On success, the number of bytes received is returned. 0 is returned when the peer has performed an orderly shutdow. Otherwise -1 is returned if an error occurred and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h).
ssize_t sal_send ( int  sockfd,
const void *  buf,
size_t  buflen,
int  flags 
)

Transmit a message on a socket.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to send
buf The buffer to send
buflen The buffer size
flags The bitwise OR of zero or more of the socket flags
Return values:
On success, 0 is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h)
ssize_t sal_sendto ( int  sockfd,
const void *  buf,
size_t  buflen,
int  flags,
const struct sockaddr *  dest_addr,
socklen_t  addrlen 
)

Transmit a message on a socket If sal_sendto() is used on a connection-mode (SOCK_STREAM) socket, the arguments dest_addr and addrlen are ignored (and the error EISCONN may be returned when they are not NULL and 0) Otherwise, the target address is given by dest_addr with addrlen specifying its size.

Parameters:
sockfd The socket descriptor used to send
buf The buffer to send
buflen The buffer size
flags The bitwise OR of zero or more of the socket flags.
dest_addr The target address
addrlen The size of the target address
Return values:
On success, 0 is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h)
int sal_socket ( int  domain,
int  type,
int  protocol 
)

Creates an endpoint for communication and returns a descriptor.

Parameters:
domain The communication domain
type The communication semantics.
protocol A protocol to be used with the socket
Return values:
On success, a file descriptor for the new socket is returned. On error, -1 is returned, and errno is set appropriately. (See errno.h)
